company: Arizona State University — Enterprise Brand Strategy & Management
description: Coordinate with the director, editors, and designers to keep ASU Thrive issues on schedule from copy readiness through handoff
Maintain the ASU All Access editorial source of truth, tracking assignments, statuses, and deadlines while surfacing blockers early
Review and proofread ASU Events submissions, fix metadata, verify links and dates, and publish approved entries with zero defects
Enforce ASU brand and accessibility guidelines across copy and images, providing clear feedback and quick fixes to contributors
Partner with QA to triage site issues, reproduce bugs, validate fixes, and communicate updates to stakeholders until resolution
Onboard and support event authors by creating accounts, writing quick how to notes, and answering workflow questions
achievements: Recognized with a Sun Award from a colleague for reliable delivery and team support
Contributed to on time magazine releases and a steady weekly publishing cadence across the ASU Events site

description: Partnered with the cofounder to turn pitch ideas into technical milestones and acceptance criteria, keeping a lightweight roadmap in Notion
Scaffolded a modular backend in Node.js and Flask with environment configs, OpenAPI docs, health checks, and structured logging
Built demo-grade services: JWT sign-in, basic role checks, and CRUD endpoints for leads and sessions; added Jest/Supertest unit tests
Containerized the stack with Docker and docker-compose; stood up a staging instance on AWS EC2 and wired GitHub Actions for lint, test, and build
Created a Postman collection and simple SDK snippets so non-engineers could run and demo flows reliably
Co-built investor pitch decks and recorded short screenflows that showcased API scenarios and multilingual copy switching
achievements: Shipped a one-command demo environment that made live walkthroughs consistent and repeatable
Established a small staging pipeline with automated checks that reduced demo-blocking issues

description: Contributed to a dynamic e-commerce site, shipping reusable UI components and smoothing cart/checkout flows
Translated design specs into accessible, responsive components; tightened semantics and error states
Led a performance pass that cut initial load by ~35% and reduced bundle size ~28%
Hooked UI to product/cart REST endpoints and wrote change docs; resolved 15+ defects across checkout
Coordinated with design and QA, turned feedback into actionable tickets, and kept status clear in standups
Presented progress in client check-ins (3+ sessions) and handled Q&A confidently
achievements: ~35% faster first load → smoother demos and better client feedback
Stabilized cart/checkout by closing priority bugs and documenting repeatable test steps

description: Imported and profiled datasets in Jupyter; wrote a short problem brief with goals and assumptions
Cleaned data (types, missing values, outliers) and engineered simple features: binning, indicators, scaling
Ran EDA with descriptive stats, group-bys, correlations, and a few focused visuals to guide features
Built baseline linear models and compared polynomial and ridge; chose models based on validation results
Used train/test with k-fold cross-validation; tracked R² and MSE and checked learning curves for over/underfit
Packaged the workflow into a scikit-learn pipeline; did a small grid search and documented steps for handoff
achievements: Delivered a reusable notebook + pipeline template that cut repeat setup by ~20%
Consistently recognized for clear communication, steady progress, and teamwork
